text: I think it would also be completely fair to add this footer to custom extensions from third parties (non-negotiable in my opinion), but I could literally just change the name of my project to “HubSpot” within our own portal. I feel like this is - albeit a small thing - actually a step back, and as an admin I believe we should be as much in control of the UI as is possible. Comparing to a similar feature @ SFDC (their LWCs), this is also not something they impose.

Hey Magnus, we looked into this, and confirmed that while you can store your subcomponents in separate files, your root .jsx file needs to be in extensions folder.  This is not ideal, and it's something we could look into it for future iterations.

Thanks for confirming, Sejal! :slightly_smiling_face:
I think this would be a great feature, so it doesn’t either get super messy or we have to set up many different projects.
<@U05FPHAQVAQ> closing the loop here - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#panel|Panels> have been released now :)
